utterance.speaker: Voice
utterance.content: The human heart is a giant muscle, squeezing or contracting over 60 times each minute. That's 3000--

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: At this point, your blood is a deep purple because it's just finished dropping off oxygen for all the parts of your body. Come on, follow me. Ian.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: I have a question, and I need to go to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Which would you like to do first?

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: The question.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Where's the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Who knows where the bathroom is?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Go with Ian to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I don't have to go.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: We're not at school, nobody goes anywhere by themselves.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: In case you get lost.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Or in case somebody kidnaps us.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: If somebody kidnaps Ian, he'll kidnap me too. I want to stay with the class.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Michael, go with Ian--

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Do you need help?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: I need you to find a grownup.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Is the baby coming? Who should I take with me?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: You’re fine. Go to the front desk or find a security guard.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: I really have to pee.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Oh god!

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Is the baby coming? I don't know how to do this.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Are you ok, Ian?

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: I don't think you are. You're bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Heeelp!!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Call.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'll call anything.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My stack's bigger than your stack. You in or out?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know that relative to their size, gorillas have smaller testicles than humans.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well then you'd probably have an edge over a gorilla, but not over me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Reason is, primate teste size inversely corresponds to the fidelity of our females.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Do you think there might be a better time to annoy me about my wife?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm talking about poker.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Women are evil, you're right to drive them away. Call fold or raise, storytime can wait!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're smaller and better than chimps, bigger and worse than gorillas. For all our rationality, our supposed trust and fealty to a higher power, our ability to create a system of rules and laws; our baser drives are more powerful than any of that. We want to control our emotions, but we can't. If we're happy, things don't annoy us. If on the other hand, we're sitting on crappy hold cards, little tiny things annoy us a whole lot more. I raise.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So are you going to tell me an annoying story everytime I raise?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God that would be annoying.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I call.

utterance.speaker: Dr Wells
utterance.content: Dr Cuddy, got one of your patients in the ER. Ian Alston, 6-yrs-old?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Err, oh, I know him, what's the problem? I'm all in.

utterance.speaker: Dr Wells
utterance.content: Bloody diarrhea. Hemodynamically stable but he's been developing some co-ordination problems.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That sounds like gastroenteritis and dehydration. Order fluids and I'll take it on my service. Bet’s to you, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They scan his head?

utterance.speaker: Dr Wells
utterance.content: No, why would they scan--

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Don't play games. You gonna call?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How's the heart rate?

utterance.speaker: Dr Wells
utterance.content: Stable.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry. House, it's gastroenteritis. I'm not going anywhere. Put the order in, and have someone tell Alan and Sarah that I'll be up when I'm done. You in or out?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm out.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh! Stone cold bluff! You might want to spend a little more time paying attention to your cards, and a little less time staring at my breasts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They don't match either. I'm going to take some air.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Follow my finger with your eyes.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: How much longer will doctor Cuddy be?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Given the number of mojitos she's knocking back at the party, I'd say it's going to be at least 3 hours before she's even conscious.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Weren't you at the same party?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't drink. I want you to reach out and grab my cane.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your son's brain is losing control of his muscles.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Dr Cuddy's message said it was just dehydration from diarrhea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's wrong.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: Is he going to be all right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: So were you in one of those cages?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No! No. No no no, those are for tourists.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: You were in the water with the Great White?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sure. It's no big deal, you just have to keep an eye on them. If they get too close, punch them in the nose, send them on their way. I had you going.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: You are mean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey! How's that anal fissure? Did it heal yet or is it still draining? Oh, I'm sorry, didn't realise you'd come back for seconds. I figured that after the girl on the stairwell you'd be done for the night.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's joking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No Adam's apple, small hands. No surprises this time.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I'll er... see you later.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got a case.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well you could have just said that, you didn't have to screw with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah if I didn't screw with you, you'd spend the whole night thinking you might get laid, which means you'd be useless. Better to extinguish all hope. Get Foreman and Cameron and meet me upstairs, stat.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What's so urgent?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two cases, same symptoms. What do 6-yr-olds and 70-yr-olds have in common?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Their immune systems don't work as well, could be Listeria.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I already checked for that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Leukemia has a higher prevalence in both young and old.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So does asthma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No no no.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Could both be diabetes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No! The nearly dead and the newly bred have more in common with each other than with people in the middle. What's weird is the kind of circle of life thing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This kid doesn't have kidney failure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He will.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Based on this file, the kid just ate some bad food. Was the old man--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They were nowhere near each other in any of the four dimensions.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: This case is 12 years old.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And this case is Cuddy's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She assigned it to me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She agrees with you that this is something more than gastroenteritis?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She wouldn't have assigned it to me if she didn't, would she?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What were we talking about?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Two patients with two symptoms in common. And 5 symptoms not in common.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: While you were all wearing your 'Frankie says Relax' T-shirts, I was treating a 73-yr-old woman who went through this progression of symptoms, the last of which was... In case any of you missed that class in med school, that one's untreatable. Kid's got the first two. Took Esther an hour and 20 mins to go from two to three. And less than a day to make it all the way to the rear exit.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This is all because a child has some blood in his diarrhea. He's got a tummy ache, if there was any reason to think it was anything worse, Cuddy would be all over it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. Do a colonoscopy.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: On a 6-yr-old kid who probably has nothing worse than some food poisoning?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you happen to find any purple papules, do me a favour and grab a slice. I want to check for Erdheim-Chester.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A disease that there have been what, maybe 200 reported cases of, ever?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If Esther's family had let me to an autopsy, there'd be 201.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: See anything?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, and I don't expect to.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House usually avoids cases. If he's actually stealing a case from Cuddy, there's gotta be a reason.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's not the first time I've seen this file. About a month before Cameron was hired, some trucker came in here with these symptoms. House decided he was dying. Two days and a spinal tap, bone marrow extraction, and three colonoscopies later, we send the guy home with a bunch of painkillers and a diagnosis of a bad cheese sandwich. One of the guys who worked here before me said House tried to cure Esther at least 3 other times. You know how people see the Virgin Mary in danishes and stuff? Someone died 12 years ago and House doesn't know why. House sees that case now in... paint peeling and clouds and now this poor kid.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Erdhem-Chester is an abnormal growth of some of the cells that fight infection.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Is that cancer? He seems ok now.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: Yeah the other doctor kind of scared us about that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He shouldn't have. We're just testing, it'll probably be negative.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: I don't understand. You don't think that's what it is but you want to do this thing to him anyway?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We need to be sure.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Isn't there any other way?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It shouldn't take long.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Those ridges look a lot like purple papules.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They’re not purple, they're red. Probably just blood blisters.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Give me the biopsy needle.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How long is this going to take?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Forget it Chase, your punching the shark story is good but she's not waiting for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We couldn't confirm the source of the bleeding but we did biopsy some--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Blood blisters.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You mean papules. Come on Cameron, who's right?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Chase is. Negative for Erdheim-Chester.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let me see. If it's not Erdheim-Chester...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's exactly what we said before, garden variety viral gastroenteritis, can we go back to the party?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do a kidney biopsy. Esther's shut down in exactly--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This kid is not Esther. You screwed up, she died, I'm sorry but that does not mean this kid is dying as well.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Geez. You get testy when you don't get any fuzz. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: What'd the test say?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Colonoscopy was clean. And the biopsy was negative for Erdheim-Chester.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: So Ian’s going to be all right? It was just some sort of virus?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Urine.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: But it's brown.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ian’s kidneys are shutting down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Still think it's not the same case?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, what can cause bloody diarrhea, ataxia and kidney failure?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll go and do a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Forget it. That battle's over. His rising creatinine is his kidney's way of saying go on without me. What explains everything?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: E. coli H0157 causes bloody diarrhea, and leads to hemolytic uremic syndrome. Toxins from the bacteria causes his kidneys to shut down, we should start him on plasmapheresis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clear, concise, and completely plausible. And exactly what I did last time, didn't work. What else?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Goodpasture's syndrome. Circulating antibodies cause kidney failure and bleeding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But not the purple papules.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you throw in Esther's next symptom - brain, makes me think heavy metal toxicity.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: His hematocrit would have to be low, it's at 44 and Esther's never dropped below...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You have the file memorised?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's my lucky number.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What about lymphoma? Causes kidney failure, GI bleed and can infiltrate the base of the brain.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You check Esther for that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She never showed any signs of... if he has lymphoma this far advanced, we should be able to see it in his blood and brain. Chase, run a blood smear and immuno-chemistries. Foreman get an MRI.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'll page Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No you won't.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She thinks the kid has a stomach ache.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She'll come right up here and do one of two things - if she agrees with me, I don't need her, if she disagrees I don't want her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You can't handle people disagreeing with you? She might have a different take on this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Subordinates can disagree with me all they want, it's healthy. People who can shut me down on the other hand... forget Cuddy, I'll have Wilson keep her busy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Keep your answers short and discrete. Is Cuddy still playing?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The chicken is still in Picadilly Square.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Brilliant. She'll never suspect that Normandy is her target.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is that House? Tell him that the blinds just went to 20-40 and he's running out of chips.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How's she doing?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well what's going on? The way you took off, something's obviously--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Love to chat but got a game to play. How's she doing?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The patient is on life support, we're about to pull the plug.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you talking about me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And what have you got?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hmm... does sound like high dose cardio meds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two hearts. You got the flush?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Still waiting on the final labs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She drinking her seltzer?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, hydration is not a problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means she's bluffing. Push her all in.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Call. Two pair. Show me your hearts.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Seven of clubs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh dear, sounds like I messed up. You're going to be stuck with her for a while. Talk to you soon.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Ohoho! Yes!

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Why are you taking a picture of his head?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We're looking for lymphoma but--

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Wait, so it's not Erdheim something and it's not his kidneys but his kidneys are failing? Where's Dr Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: Erm Dr House mentioned another case, is there another patient with the same thing that Ian has?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Not exactly.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Dr House had a patient a while back who exhibited the same symptoms as your son--

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Then you know what's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: So what do you know?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We know the likely course the disease will take.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: Which is?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She had multiple system failures--

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: What happened to her?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She... died 24 hours after her admission.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mr or Mrs Alston, would you mind giving me a hand? He's having trouble sitting still and it's impossible to get the detail we need. So I figure he might feel more comfortable hearing your voices.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Ian honey, just sit still, they'll be done in a moment, we're here with you.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: I'm scared.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: It's ok, honey. It's... it's only a big camera. It's going to take a picture of your head. You love it when I take your picture at home, don't you?

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: And you have to hold still for that too, right?

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: But this isn't like that.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: I know it's scary, Ian, but you can do it. You're getting to be so grown up. So just hold perfectly still, just for a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Mommy are you crying?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: No, no honey, I'm just tired.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Okay, I'll try.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The base of his brain’s been infiltrated by a small mass. We think--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pituitary?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Looks that way.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Explains the low blood pressure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretty much confirms the lymphoma. Should have started Esther on prednisone.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Err... did anyone see the lymphoma?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, we saw a mass. The location's consistent with--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Didn't see any in the blood either. White blood cells show no spindling, or abnormal nuclei, nothing on immuno-chemistries either. It's not lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a train. We don't know what kind of train--

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Woah

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm thirsty.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's closed!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not now. We've got one advantage. We know where the tracks are going.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The fact that the end of the line is death... is an advantage?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The fact that we know is an advantage. Which means we can get ahead of it. Next station is the liver. We've got about 90 minutes before it gets there. Maybe we can cut down a tree across the line just outside of town.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll do an ultrasound.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, treatment will tell us more faster.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How can we start treatment if we have no idea what we're treating for?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Treat him for everything! Give him acetylcysteine and interferon and silymarine and whatever else you can think of to protect the liver.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh just catching up on some TV. How're you doing?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well thanks to your last consult, the patient has improved dramatically.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tell House the patient is about to kill the doctor.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She says the patient--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I heard. What've you got?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well Cuddy just raised and err...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're paired.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nines?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anything lower, you wouldn't sound so excited. Jacks are higher, your voice sounds like Debbie from accounting is sitting in your lap. Ask Cuddy if she can beat a pair of threes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Wait, wha... what's going on? If you're going to mess with me, wouldn't it be more fun to do it in person?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, it would.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Erm... can you beat a pair of threes?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did she do?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I left orders for PO fluids, doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Enough with the codes, she obviously knows it's me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She's drinking her seltzer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did she stop?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go all in.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Umm... but...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just do it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You couldn't care less about this charity event, you claim not to be messing with me, obviously you're either trying to keep me--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shut up! Look, last time I wanted the game to go on. I still do. Means that this time you get to win.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hold on.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I fold.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ohohoho! House, are you sure you're ok?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Meds seem to be working. Liver's holding its own.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But the platelets are dropping.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Even better.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why? It means he's getting sicker.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's new. New is good. Because old ended in death.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: I can't breathe.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Chase!

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: What? What's happening? Ian come on now, honey, just relax! Ian, breathe, come on honey! Please! Please, honey!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We had to put him on a ventilator.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's back on Esther's path. We managed to make the train skip a few stations which means that instead of 12 hours, he's probably got less than two. Which begs the question why. What did we do?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Acetylcysteine could mess with the lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mess with them, not shut them down in 20 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Interferon modulates the immune system. It could affect a cancer of the blood like one of the leukemias.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Doesn't speed them up it slows them down.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Slows down all five hundred of them?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anybody know where we can find an oncologist at this hour?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What effects would interferon have on leukemia?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Depends on what type. Could make it better, could make it worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Four-year fellowship to learn that.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tell House if he wants to play cards he can get his ass back down here and play.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You hear that? She wants me off the phone, means she's vulnerable. Go all in.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But um... the party's over in less than 3 hours.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's over in less than 2 hours. Which means you either have 3 of a kind or just 3's. I'm guessing 3's. I bet five hundred.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go all in.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You obviously want to bust me . Why would you--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either you go all in or I tell everybody in the building that you wear toenail polish.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm all in.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'll... call. I'm betting you have a pair of threes, but even if you have three, it's not going to beat Trip nines.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, oh, oh no, oh no! Ohhhh that's gotta hurt.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I just killed two birds with one straight. Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine, keep playing, but I need you to recommend a good Oncologist because if I don't get one up here in the next few minutes, I got a dead 6-yr-old.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you need help, ask. These games are insane.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Games have a higher success rate.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, I don't see anything that looks like leukemia. You do a bone marrow biopsy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No time.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Even if there is an occult blood cancer, you wouldn't expect interferon to make it worse. And certainly not this fast.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What would move this fast?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Auto-immune diseases. His body's own defenses are attacking him and beefing them up is just going to put fuel on the fire.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sarcoidosis could be in his brain and lungs.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, no enlarged hilar lymph nodes on his chest x-ray.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The systemic nature suggests juvenile rheumatoid arthritis.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Or Kawasaki's disease.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Can't be Kawasaki's. That doesn't affect the elderly.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Err the... this is a kid's x-ray.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House had another patient.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Who may or may not have had Kawasaki's. This kid on the other hand, he makes antibodies that are eating the inside of his arteries, choking off blood to his major organs one by one. First the GI tract, then the kidneys, then the brain, now the lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can anyone think of a reason why Kawasaki's can't affect the elderly? Other than it doesn't. Nice.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can confirm with bloodwork. We need an ANA, sed rate--

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Labs will take 2 hours.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What was the old lady's sed rate?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Elevated. 98.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You can't use another patient's labs to diagnose Kawasaki's disease!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that like a dare or something?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You don't have time to be wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. We'll look for Kawasaki where he lives, Ian's coronary arteries.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This other patient... the old lady... Esther?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Have you read Moby Dick?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was a book?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It was 10 years ago.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Obsession is dangerous.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only if you're on a wooden ship and your obsession is a whale. I think I'm in the clear.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You do realise it's a metaphor?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You do realise that the point of metaphors is to scare people from doing things by telling them that something much scarier is going to happen than what will really happen? God I wish I had a metaphor to explain that better. Go back to the game. Don't worry, I'm not going to get eaten by witches.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Coronary arteries clear. No aneurysms.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Flip the mode, let's see the flow.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: How did that other woman die?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She went into respiratory distress. Her heart and liver were already--

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: No. Did she suffer? Was she in pain?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No blood clots, no ragged edges.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Damn. Shut it down, we're just wasting time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Look at the right atrium.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That's not Kawasaki's.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's small, but it's there.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Esther didn't have a mass in her heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ian's younger. He can take more of a pounding. Esther died before the disease reached her heart. The disease made a mass and made it fast.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Could be bacteria.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Or muscle.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Connective tissue?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kid can't take any more theories. Only thing we know is that whatever that mass is, that's what he's got. We need a piece of it. I'm doing a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll shut the blinds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No let them watch, I do my best work on the big stage. Passing through the superior vena cava.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're in the atrium. Pull back. You've hit the wall of the heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: These procedures would be so much simpler if you could do them on healthy people. And out again. V fib!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cardiac arrest! Call a code.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on, paddles! Come on.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Charged.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: Over the announcement system
utterance.content: Code blue, Iso room. Code blue, Iso room.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And again.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got a clock on this?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How much longer are you going to keep doing this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wait! I've got something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doing what we came here to do.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It almost killed him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know, I was right here. Give me a vacutainer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His brain's been oxygen-deprived for over 8 minutes. There might be nothing left, he might--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell the parents. Where the hell is that vacutainer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, what's he got?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Brain damage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good chance. I was talking about before that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You're not worried about--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Things I can't do anything about, I try not to.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Huh, yeah, things just roll off you like water off a duck.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Histiocytosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Very unlikely in a 73-yr-old.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whatever this is is very unlikely. Come on, more ideas, let's go people.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Genetic disorders could cause masses everywhere. Tuberous sclerosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If it's genetic he's had it all his life, why now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know, it sure fits nice enough.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We haven't ruled out leukemia yet.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Or sarcoma. He could have multiple soft tissue tumors.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Or sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Multiple neurofibromatosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Chondrocytomas.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How's it going? You win?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I got called away. By the angry parents of a patient. There are THREE of you here, none of you had the sense to stop him, to pick up a phone and call me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told them you'd signed off. The parents are mad because their kid is dying, that's understandable. But if he doesn't die, they won't be mad anymore.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well if he's brain-damaged, they might still be a little ticked.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I had to do it to save him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You had to do it to diagnose Esther. You may have killed a 6-yr-old because you're obsessed with a woman who's been dead for 12 years. Sometimes you lose, House. You're not God!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not dead yet.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, but you're done with him, it's my case now. Go home, go ride your motorcycle, go brood in a dark room, just don't go near Ian again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, anything else or is it just these seven?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Drop it House, she's right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No she's not. You know she's not.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We should have called her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm surprised you didn't.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You're going to have to find a way to let this go. We can't go near Ian.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We don't need to go near him, we have his tumor. Cuddy may be right that we screwed up the protocol, she may be right about my screwed up obsession, but I'm right about the medicine. How many tests can we do with that? Look, we cure the kid we solve everybody's problems. How many?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Maybe two good pieces.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How many okay pieces?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Three would be pushing it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Three tests, seven choices. Okay, what's first?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sarcoidosis seems most likely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, so likely that Cuddy's going to think of that all on her own. She's got the kid's whole body to play with. Let her do that test. What's next?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's moving too fast to be spreading. It has to be growing from something that's already--

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Genetic disorder - tuberous sclerosis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Or it's his immune system, histiocytosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well there are more documented cases of histio amongst older people than tuberous sclerosis, let's start with that.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wing or drumstick?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Going to need a little more than that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: A little more is more than a third.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If we have to repeat this test because you didn't cut us enough...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Adding one micro litre of the immunoperoxidase.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Make it two. I don't want House biting off our heads because we weren't sure if it turned red or not.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That's definitely not red.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The problem could still be an abnormal cell growth but a different cell line.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sarcoma? Muscle cells throughout his body? Would explain the geography.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Genetic disorder's far more likely in a 6-yr-old. Tuberous sclerosis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pretty unlikely to cause a GI bleed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Time course fits.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mr Foreman, you agree with both of them? Thanks for playing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If we have enough tissue for two tests, why not do both?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then we don't have to think as hard. Taking the pressure off the choice makes us less likely to think critically.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sarcoma is more likely to hit a 6 and 70 yr old.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tuberous sclerosis it is.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You think sarcoma's less likely?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's more likely, the test for it on the other hand, is less reliable.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nestin's negative.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Oh that's ok, if the tumor cells haven't matured, the KR67 protein wouldn't have turned off. What happens if we don't solve this?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Kid dies.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I mean for the next 12 years.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: KR67's negative. And PCH antigen is negative.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mighty Casey is down to his last strike.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mighty Casey struck out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thanks a lot, didn't read that this weekend.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Chondrocytoma. Connective tissue has been in all the places that we've been looking.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The kid is too sick for that, we're better off testing for sarcoma.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We would have seen signs of that when we tested for tuberous sclerosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The tumor cells looked like muscle under the microscope.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, they didn't. They looked like fat.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I vote for neurofibromatosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because the other choices suck worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Give me a minute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want me out of here?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You come up with anything?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We can talk about it tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I erm... I won the poker tournament. I totally played this guy Burman from Business Affairs. I got great cards, but I don't bet. Just call, no raises. Burman pairs his king on the flop, I keep calling, the river turns, I check. He can't stand it. He goes all in, he's sure he's won. I call. I flip 'em. Oh!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pocket aces.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I nailed his ass!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The aces were hiding all along.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Test him for Erdheim-Chester disease.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Erdheim-Chester? That's not even on the list!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because we already did it. He tested negative.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So did Esther.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Disease lied.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah, the tumor's got it in for you. Diseases don't lie.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine, it didn't lie, it slow played us. We biopsied the colon, it hadn't reached the GI tract yet. It's there now. It's in his liver, his lungs--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want it to be there. Because then you didn't screw up 12 years ago.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can't waste our one test on the one disease we know it's not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Run the test.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You sure about this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wait, let me think about that. Don't pressure me. Just run the damn test.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Cells look like macrophages.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's a good start.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take your time and say it loud.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: CD 68 positive

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start the treatment.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So Esther can rest peaceful now huh?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Forty. You got lucky. You going to call?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What I do, is not just based on the flip of a card.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You guessed. You got lucky.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It fit.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It could just as easily have been sarcoma or tuberous sclerosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, not just as easily.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe not. But it wasn't impossible. Are you going to call?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, relative to it's size, the barnacle has the largest penis of any animal.
